text: What the human mind can comprehend and believe, it can achieve
author: Napoleon Hill, journalist and writer

text: Strive not for success, but for the values ​​it provides​
author: Albert Einstein

text: I owe my success to never making excuses or accepting excuses from others
author: Florence Nightingale

text: In my career I've missed over 9000 shots, lost almost 300 games
author: Michael Jordan

text: The hardest thing is getting started, everything else depends on perseverance
author: Amelia Earhart

text: One must love life more than the meaning of life
author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

text: Life is what happens to you while you make plans
author: John Lennon

text: Logic can take you from point A to point B, imagination can take you anywhere
author: Albert Einstein

text: In 20 years, you'll be more disappointed with the things you didn't do than with the things you did
author: Mark Twain

text: It's always worth starting with something that sows doubt
author: Boris Strugatsky

text: Real responsibility is only personal
author: Fazil Iskander

text: A meaningless life is not worth living
author: Socrates

text: 80% success is showing up in the right place at the right time
author: Woody Allen

text: Your time is limited, don't waste it living someone else's life
author: Steve Jobs

text: Winning isn't everything, everything is a constant desire to win
author: Vince Lombardi, American football coach

text: Science is organized knowledge, wisdom is organized life
author: Immanuel Kant

text: I don't have the word 'impossible' in my dictionary
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

text: You will never cross the ocean unless you have the courage to lose sight of the shore
author: Christopher Columbus

text: Freedom is worthless unless it includes the freedom to make mistakes
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Either you rule your day, or the day rules you
author: Jim Rohn, public speaker and business coach

text: If you think you can do something, you're right; if you think you can't do it, you're right too
author: Henry Ford

text: The two most important days in your life: the day you were born and the day you realized why
author: Mark Twain

text: Start doing everything you can do - and even what you can even dream of
author: Johann Wolfgang Goethe

text: The best revenge is a huge success
author: Frank Sinatra

text: It's often said that motivation doesn't last long
author: Zig Ziglar, writer, businessman and marketing consultant

text: Weak people try their whole lives to be as good as others
author: Boris Akunin

text: It's all about thoughts
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: There is only one way to avoid criticism: do nothing, say nothing and be nothing
author: Aristotle

text: The person you are meant to be is only the person you choose to become
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson, essayist, poet and philosopher

text: Walk confidently towards your dream
author: Henry David Thoreau, writer, thinker, naturalist

text: I hope that at the end of my days, when I stand before God, I won't have a shred of talent left to tell him, 'I used everything you gave me'
author: Erma Bombeck, writer, journalist

text: It's better to be sure of a good result than to hope for a great one
author: Warren Buffett

text: Some things can grab your attention, but focus on the things that grab your heart
author: Indian proverb

text: You only have to believe that you can - and you are already halfway to the goal
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Don't blame a child for being afraid of the dark
author: Plato

text: Learn to say 'I don't know' and that will be progress
author: Moses Maimonides, Jewish philosopher and theologian

text: Start where you are
author: Arthur Ash, tennis player

text: When I was 5 years old, my mother always said that the main thing in life is happiness
author: John Lennon

text: Fall down seven times and get up eight times
author: Japanese pog

text: When one door to happiness closes, another one opens
author: Helen Keller, writer, lecturer, political activist

text: Everything has its beauty, but not everyone can see it
author: Confucius

text: It's great not to have to wait even a minute to start making the world a better place
author: Anne Frank

text: When I let go of who I am, I become who I can be
author: Lao Tzu

text: Happiness is not something ready made
author: Dalai Lama

text: If you're offered a seat in a booster, don't ask what seat it is! Just take it
author: Sheryl Sandberg, Facebook COO

text: First decide on your ideal: set a goal
author: Aristotle

text: If there is no wind, take the oars
author: Latin proverb

text: Always keep in mind that your own decision to succeed is more important than anything else
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Success is the ability to go from defeat to defeat without losing optimism
author: Winston Churchill

text: They ask, -How can you get everything done in fifteen minutes?' I say -It's simple
author: Richard Branson, British entrepreneur, founder of Virgin Corporation

text: Everyone wants to change humanity, but no one thinks about how to change themselves
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: It is important to believe that talent is given to us for a reason - and that at any cost it must be used for something
author: Marie Curie

text: If an inner voice tells you that you can't draw - draw as much as you can, then that voice will quieten down
author: Vincent van Gogh

text: Definiteness of purpose is the starting point of all achievement
author: William Clement Stone, writer and businessman

text: We become what we think
author: Earl Nightingale, radio host

text: I am not a victim of circumstance, I am the result of my decisions
author: Stephen Covey, Organizational Management Consultant and Educator

text: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago
author: Chinese proverb

text: All children are artists
author: Pablo Picasso

text: I was struck by the importance of taking action
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: What is money? A person is successful if he wakes up in the morning, goes back to bed in the evening, and does what he likes during the break
author: Bob Dylan

text: I didn't fail the test
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Defeat is not defeat unless you recognize it as such in your mind
author: Bruce Lee

text: Failure is just an opportunity to start again, but wiser
author: Henry Ford

text: I'm sure you can't let the poor word 'no' stop you
author: Richard Branson

text: Only those who never try new things never make mistakes
author: Albert Einstein

text: You become what you believe in
author: Oprah Winfrey, television personality

text: Happiness is not always doing what you want, but always wanting what you do
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: I'd rather die of passion than boredom
author: Vincent van Gogh

text: You learn the fastest in three cases - before the age of 7, at trainings, and when life has cornered you
author: Stephen Covey

text: People will forget what you said, forget what you did, but never forget how you made them feel
author: Maya Angelou, writer and poet

text: Our consciousness is everything
author: Buddha

text: If you want to build a ship, don't call people, plan, divide work, get tools
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

text: Never think you already know everything
author: Ivan Pavlov, physiologist

text: It doesn't matter how slowly you walk, but how long you walk without stopping
author: Confucius

text: If you think about what you have in life, you can always have more
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: Turn your big thoughts into big actions as quickly as possible
author: Donald Trump

text: To lead people, follow them
author: Lao Tzu

text: Remember that failing to succeed is sometimes also a great success
author: Dalai Lama

text: Always choose the hardest path - you won't meet competitors on it
author: Charles de Gaulle

text: One completed successful task is worth fifty half-finished tasks
author: Malcolm Forbes

text: Our life begins to come to an end when we stop talking about the really important things
author: Martin Luther King Jr

text: Trouble doesn't come alone, but luck does too
author: Romain Rolland, writer

text: Any thought is like a dough, once you knead it well, you can make everything out of it
author: Ivan Turgenev

text: Do your best where you are, using everything you have
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Remember, no one can make you feel inferior without your consent
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: The world is divided into two classes - some believe in the incredible, others do the impossible
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The only happiness in life is the constant striving forward
author: Emile Zola

text: It's not the strongest who survive, but the most receptive to change
author: Charles Darwin

text: You can say that you have bad genetics, bad metabolism, or you can just get your ass off the couch and start working on yourself, set a goal and believe in yourself
author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

text: Never falling down is not the greatest merit in life
author: Nelson Mandela

text: The question is not who will allow me, but who can forbid me
author: Ayn Rand

text: When it seems like the whole world is against you, remember that the plane takes off against the wind, not against it
author: Henry Ford

text: Life is measured not by how many years it has, but by how many years of real life there are
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Doing good for the world is the only way to be happy
author: Hans Christian Andersen

text: Either write something worthwhile or do something worth writing about
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: The only way to do something very well is to love what you do
author: Steve Jobs

text: A wise man demands everything from himself, while an insignificant person demands everything from others
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: Great are those who see that thoughts rule the world
author: Ralph Emerson

text: Before climbing the ladder of success, make sure it is leaning against the wall of the building you want
author: Stephen Covey

text: At the origin of every successful venture is a bold decision once made
author: Peter Drucker, American economist
